Package lib.controller

Class SocialController

java.lang.Object
lib.controller.SocialController
public class SocialController extends Object
Controller for all social media interactions.

  • Method Details

    • getInteractionsByUserId

      public static List<Interaction> getInteractionsByUserId(int userId)
      Based on a user's ID, returns a list of interactions for that user. This should get the global interactions and all interactions that belong to groups the user is a part of, then sort that list by timestamp, latest first.
      Parameters:
      userId -
      Returns:

    • getInteractionsByGroupId

      public static List<Interaction> getInteractionsByGroupId(int groupId)
      Based on a group Id, returns the interactions for that group, sorted by timestamp.
      Parameters:
      groupId -
      Returns:

    • postRootComment

      public static void postRootComment(User user, int groupId, String comment)
      Creates a root comment interaction. The interaction is owned by the User, belongs to the groupId, and is of type InteractionType.ORIGINAL_CONTENT. If the user does not belong to the target groupId, reject the post, as users can only post comments to groups they're members in.
      Parameters:
      user -
      groupId -
      comment -

    • getInteractionById

      public static Interaction getInteractionById(int interactionId)
      Looks up and returns an interaction by ID.
      Parameters:
      interactionId -
      Returns:

    • editComment

      public static void editComment(User user, int interactionId, String newComment)
      Replaces the content of an existing comment with new content. The user must be the owner of the interaction (i.e. the only comments the user can edit are their own), and the interaction must actually have content (it must be either InteractionType.ORIGINAL_CONTENT or InteractionType.COMMENT_ON_CONTENT
      Parameters:
      interactionId -
      newComment -

    • postReplyComment

      public static void postReplyComment(User user, int interactionId, String comment)
      Creates a comment reply interaction. The interaction is owned by the user but the target interaction may not be. The user must belong to the group of the target interaction, otherwise reject the post. This interaction should be of type InteractionType.COMMENT_ON_CONTENT
      Parameters:
      user -
      interactionId -
      comment -

    • likeComment

      public static void likeComment(User user, int interactionId)
      Creates a like interaction for a comment. There should be no restriction on anyone liking anyone else's content, but the target interaction must be either InteractionType.ORIGINAL_CONTENT or InteractionType.COMMENT_ON_CONTENT so we don't get people liking each other's likes.
      Parameters:
      user -
      interactionId -

    • shareComment

      public static void shareComment(User user, int interactionId)
      Creates a share interaction for a comment. The target interaction must be either InteractionType.ORIGINAL_CONTENT or InteractionType.COMMENT_ON_CONTENT, and this function should *also* generate a brand new RootComment that clones the target interaction - "User foobar has shared this comment - " + the original content of the comment that got shared So two interactions should be made here - an interaction indicating something was shared, *and* an interaction that literally shares the original post as a new comment to the global group.
      Parameters:
      user -
      interactionId -

    • createNewGroup

      public static void createNewGroup(User user, String name, String description)
      Creates a new group. This group is owned by the creating user and has a name, type, and description.
      Parameters:
      user -
      name -
      description -

    • updateGroupWithGroupId

      public static void updateGroupWithGroupId(int groupId, User user, String description)
      Updates the group with the targeted id by setting a new description, then re-saving the record. Does *not* update the field if the argument is null or empty. Reject the update if the user does not own the group (which means they dont have permissions to modify it).
      Parameters:
      groupId -
      description -

    • joinGroup

      public static void joinGroup(int groupId, User user)
      Adds the user to the group. No effect if they're already in the group.
      Parameters:
      groupId -
      user -

    • leaveGroup

      public static void leaveGroup(int groupId, User user)
      Removes the user from the group. No effect if they weren't in the group already.
      Parameters:
      groupId -
      user -

    • listAllMeetings

      public static List<Meeting> listAllMeetings()
      Returns a list of all meetings, sorted chronologically.
      Returns:

    • listAllMeetings

      public static List<Meeting> listAllMeetings(User user)
      Returns a list of all meetings for the provided user, i.e. all meetings for the groups this user is a member of.
      Returns:

    • createMeeting

      public static void createMeeting(int groupId, User user, String location, String day, String time)
      Creates a meeting for the group with id groupId. Sets its location to location, and sets the Date to the Date corresponding to the day (provided in MM/DD/YYYY) and time (2400 format). Rejects creation if the user isn't a member of the group.
      Parameters:
      groupId -
      location -
      day -
      time -

    • updateMeetingWithMeetingId

      public static void updateMeetingWithMeetingId(int meetingId, User user, String location, String day, String time)
      Updates a meeting with id meetingId with the updated location and date. Does not update the fields if null, so if the user doesn't provide a day or time, don't update the date. Rejects the update if the user isn't a member of the group the meeting is for.
      Parameters:
      meetingId -
      user -
      location -
      day -
      time -
